summary: A whisper away from a beautiful end - Chapter 8
title: A whisper away from a beautiful end - Chapter 8
description:
When I take the Seven Kingdoms, I need you by my side.

Not even death could keep Jorah Mormont from obeying his Queen’s command.

summary: IF Dany had lived & tried to rid the Known World of evil. She would’ve died. Since The Known World has many sicknesses that kill...
body: IF Dany had lived & tried to rid the Known World of evil. She would’ve died. Since The Known World has many sicknesses that kill you fast. And with Dany being inbred she possibly had a weak immune system.

reblog.comment: IF Dany had lived & tried to rid the Known World of evil. She would’ve died. Since The Known World has many sicknesses that kill you fast. And with Dany being inbred she possibly had a weak immune system.

summary: Imagine hating Daenerys so much that you think Drogon ate her body rather than bringing her to the Red Priestess' in Volantis....

Imagine hating Daenerys so much that you think Drogon ate her body rather than bringing her to the Red Priestess’ in Volantis. Can’t relate.

Also WTF Google for making this pop up in the first place.

summary: “Because men love according to their own will and fear according to the will of the prince, a wise prince should establish...
body:
“Because men love according to their own will and fear according to the will of the prince, a wise prince should establish himself on that which is in his own control and not in the control of others.” - Machiavelli

I found the above quote from reading the following article called  “ ‘GoT’ Finale: Political Philosophy Explains Why “Mad Queen” Dany Was Right “.

What I find ironic about this article is that  Olenna Tyrell was the only one who had advised Daenerys to “be a dragon” and forget the idea of trying to win the love of Westeros’ citizens in order to win the war.

reblog.comment:

blog.name: valyrhos
blog.title: Piecing Together Character Arcs
blog.description:
Hi, I'm Rheia, I love spending my life overanalysing fantasy novels. Welcome to my descent into madness.
We Stan Daenerys in this household.

summary: You know what actually Fucking Kills me about Daenerys’ death? It was just so unceremonious. You follow this girl, freeing...
body:
You know what actually Fucking Kills me about Daenerys’ death?

It was just so unceremonious.

You follow this girl, freeing slaves, growing up, learning and making mistakes for years upon years, and then she snaps and she dies.. But she doesn’t even get any last words? Not even a hand gesture as she bleeds out? Nothing at all? Dany ceased to be a character and it goddamn kills me that she was gone long before she got stabbed in the heart.

reblog.comment:

Not even a hand gesture as she bleeds out? Nothing at all? Dany ceased to be a character and it goddamn kills me that she was gone long before she got stabbed in the heart.

Not even a hand gesture as she bleeds out? Nothing at all? Dany ceased to be a character and it goddamn kills me that she was gone long before she got stabbed in the heart.
trail.content:

It was just so unceremonious.

You follow this girl, freeing slaves, growing up, learning and making mistakes for years upon years, and then she snaps and she dies.. But she doesn’t even get any last words? Not even a hand gesture as she bleeds out? Nothing at all? Dany ceased to be a character and it goddamn kills me that she was gone long before she got stabbed in the heart.

blog.name: marta-elentari
blog.title: VARDA ELENTARÍ
blog.description: Marta | She/Her | 21 | Med student | 🇷🇴 | Orthodox Christian | Hetero-demisexual, but gay for Varda Elentari | Ask box open I Major Tolkien fan, meaning that I post/reblog anything L0TR and Silmarillion related | Love AS0IAF too (but totally anti Game of Clowns) | Melkor & Varda specialist | In this house, we also stan Tywin Lannister (and our lord and saviour Charles Dance), Joanna Lannister and Daenerys Targaryen | Therefore I am 50% Lann 50% Targ | If you like Sansa Stark, this is not the place for you | Melkor & Varda and Tywin & Joanna are my OTPs | I paint and I write metas | I love making edits as well | Shitposting will go ever on and on on this page | I also post/discuss/reblog things about other fantasy series I like, such as Harry Potter, Witcher, Wheel of Time and Kingkiller Chronicle | Sideblog: @star-crossedvoyager (mostly for anti sjm posts) | You can find me on insta: @martaaaisabella (my personal account); @martaaa1506 (for Tolkien stuff and anti SJM shitposts)

summary: your ending is much better that the one the show gave us or the book will gave us, so I considere it the true canon, she will...
question: your ending is much better that the one the show gave us or the book will gave us, so I considere it the true canon, she will chose a dream of spring, remaking the world from the ashes of the iron throne which she will burn
answer:
Thank you!❤ I talked about how I would see the ending in another asks. In my ending, the North becomes independent under the rule of King Bran. Dorne and the Iron Islands (who were historically independent) will regain their independence under the rule of Queen Arianne and Queen Asha, respectively. Both of them are women whose arc revolves around the idea of ruling. The rest of the Seven Kingdoms (Five Kingdoms??) becomes the Kingdom of Queen Daenerys and her child by Jon. As I said in another ask, I LIKE JON A LOT, but the bittersweet ending I see is him dying heroically, so his wife (They will be married by that time) and child can live in a better world. Or maybe Dany will be just the Queen of Crownlands and the rest of the kingdoms will become independent as well, it is possible. I see her changing the system and then leaving somewhere to live a peaceful life with her child. And yes, she’ll burn the Iron Throne, symbolizing the death of the old world and old system.

As for the three heads of the Dragon:

  • Dany is Azor Ahai (and rides Drogon)
  • Jon is the Prince that was promised (rides Rhaegal)
  • Bran is the last hero and the new Bran the Builder Bran the Broken is the stupidest title I’ve ever heard (who will warg into Viserion, forshadowed here: “You will never walk again, but you will fly”)
